===== OLD REVIEW =====

Small nifty game with player constructed content.

Take the cons with a grain of salt, as it's an early access title and still in devlopment.

Pros:
- Level Editor with cool traps and effects
- Earning currency is easy
- Already some very cool player made levels
- The average rating discount system encourages good levels

Contras:
- Animations feel clunky, especially sliding and 
- Controls don't feel sensitive enough for a fast paced jump 'n run
- Although earning money is easy, traps and non standard blocks cost too much which results in a lot of bland levels
- The level editor still needs some work (multi selection is not possible, GUI elements feel out of proportion)


I still enjoy the game and making levels for it.

review: This is a cute game. Though I didn't want to mess with the other half of it (the player/build-your-own sections), I enjoyed the developer levels available. I appreciate not having the auto run and the controls were fairly intuitive. I notice a lot of people complaining about the view. I think it is a good distance, though I will admit I exited out of a level or two so that I could see the whole layout of the level again. If the object is to get a quick idea and then stumble your way through a trap-filled maze, this works very well. However, if it's just to get through the levels, it'd be nice to have a "bring up the map" button--it could even keep the sand running. Other things to note: It was extremely frustrating to die merely touching the dropping foot, even if it wasn't dropping; there is a dun-dun-dun glitching sort of sound whenever I hit respawn; and it has cute artwork.

review:
Какое же гoвнo.

Я даже просить прощения за грубости не буду.
Мало того, что здесь просто отвратительная графика, так и сам геймплей кривой просто до "нЕльзя". Да, у нас есть 404sight, да, там тоже местами корявое управление, но эти игры разнятся настолько, как если бы мы сравнивали гта5 и гилти гир релоад. Работало разное количество людей, и разное количество времени и сил было затрачено, но обра проекта - прекрасны. Ну... Наверное. Я не играл в гта5. И гта4 тоже. Не важно! Суть в другом - разработчики этой игры, откровенно говоря, подсунули поднос с фекaлиями в надежде, что мы будем это кушать. И если хоть кто-то из них заикнётся: "НУ У НАС НЕ БЫЛО ДОСТАТОЧНО СИЛ И ВРЕМЕНИ, МЫ ИНДИ-РАЗРАБЫ, КО КО КО", я вытащу свой десёрт игл, возьму несколько сорок четвёртых, и разнесу им головы в чёртово мясо, точно так же, как они разнесли мою нервную систему своей... "игрой". Единственное, что хорошо в этой игре - это начальный трек. Я удивился, что во время туториала не было никакой музыки вообще, но, наверное, это должно было нам помочь сконцетрироваться. Ну знаете... 
Нажимать на пробел.
Было пару вещей, от которых мне успело пригореть, когда я даже толком игру не опробовал. Вот три вещи, после которых я полностью осознал, с чем же я имею дело.
1.) Я пробежал взрывоопасную бочку. Сквозь неё. И остался жив. Ну... В каком-то смысле жив, ведь мы играем за мумию и всё такое. Потом я, из уважения к взрывным вещестам, пробежал обратно и взорвался, но... Не услышал звука взрыва. ВООБЩЕ. Хм. Интересненько тут у вас.
2.) Я прыгал от стены к стене пытаясь забраться выше и выше и... Я просто прилип к стене не имея возможности прыгать. Кто-то пролил супер клей? Или кто-то сделал плохую игру?
3.) Я зашёл в "магазин". И знаете что? Там продают 4000 единиц донат валюты за 99 $.

..,

Я скорее изнасилую лосося спичкой, чем заплачу хотя бы РУБЛЬ, белорусский, за такую парaшу.
Серьёзно, а кто-то вообще был настолько самоубийцей, чтобы донатить в этой... """игре"""? Кому-то потом батя по шее не вломил с ноги и не задал Вам интересующий нас всех вопрос: "НА*УЯ?!"
Ни у кого такого не было? Потому что это был бы КРАЙНЕ спорный момент в Вашей жизни.

Мне кажется, Сатана запишет Вам в Книгу Судьбы бОльший грех за один только запуск этой игры, чем за изнасилование маленькой девочки, а быть может, БЫТЬ МОЖЕТ, даже и двух. Всё зависит от того, насколько плоха эта игра в целом, я бы узнал, если бы я поиграл в неё чуть больше, чем 10 минут, и закончил хотя бы одну "главу". Но я не смог.

P.S. И что вообще значит РАННИЙ ДОСТУП? У этой игры?! Это что, шутка такая?!

Вердикт заключается в том, что нам предоставили откровенно хeровый, по всем показателям, кусок навоза, который называется игрой. Просто не тратьте на это своё время, целее будет Ваша нервная система в итоге. Графика, геймплей, всё это похоже на протухший борщ. Лишь музыка, начальный трек, звучала достаточно годно. НО НА ЭТОМ ВСЁ!

Я не собираюсь тратить своё время на гoвнистую поигрульку, разработчики которой обладают настолько огромным эго, что ВООБЩЕ ПОСМЕЛИ (!!!) даже ПОДУМАТЬ только о том, чтобы добавить в магазин иконку: "4к donate for 99$".
Донатить? 99 долларов? В ЭТО?!

Да пошли Вы на*уй, вот что я скажу. Фу. Адская мерзость.

9 из 10 за начальный трек.
0 из 10 за остальную... "игру".

review:
Decent idea with a god auful execution. Even for a an early access game, this game has ridiculous bugs that should have been fixed before going public. Bugs such as sometimes climbing up an invisible block while trying to walljump, or if you jump fast enough just going straight through the wall. All of this could be forgiven, but for some reason the creator decided to make you have to pay for items in the in game shop, but the only way to gain money is to play levels, or for people to beat yours. This creates two problems:
1. You start with hardly any money whatsoever. I think you get enough for 3 or 4 spikes. That's hardly enough to make a level that's difficult or interesting.
2. The fact that you gain money for simply having people beat your levels gives absolutely no inscentive for you to make them difficult, or even possible to fail. Why would you, when that only cuts down your profits. In the current version of the game, there is absolutely nothing stopping me from just making a level that has the start and exit next to each other. That is not good game design.

This game needs to be thoroughly improved before anyone should even consider playing it, never mind spending their hard earned cash on it.

review:
Bis jetzt gefällt mir das Spiel echt super, hat einen hohen Suchtfaktor und man möchte unbedingt immer weiter kommen. Die Charaktere und Fallen sind lustig gestaltet und geben dem Spiel einen einmaligen Charme. :D 
Und die Musik ist der Hammer!

Hier und da kann allerdings noch ein bisschen gefeilt werden.

Verbesserungsvorschläge: 
- Im Shop mit dem Mausrad scrollen ist nahezu unmöglich, da es extrem langsam scrollt. 
- Die "Fuß-Fallen" sollten einen nicht mehr zertreten wenn sie gerade schon nach oben gehen während man dagegen rennt.
- Evtl. könnte man einbauen, dass man am Anfang eines Levels in der großen Übersicht selbst noch kurz durchs Level scrollen kann, um zu sehen was auf einen zukommt. (Was andererseits wiederum den Spielspaß ein bisschen eindämmen könnte, wenn man auf Überraschungen steht ^^)
- Die Musik stoppt immer wieder zu scheinbar wilkürlichen Zeiten und wird dann auch genauso wilkürlich wieder eingespielt. Darf gerne durchgehend laufen, der Sound ist klasse!

Weiter so, dieses Spiel hat definitiv großes Potenzial!

author: {'steamid': '76561198164782653', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 62, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1444862747}
review:
There's a potentially fun game in here somewhere, but there's quite a bit that doesn't make this work overall, and makes it so that I can't recommend it, even in Early Access as it grows and develops.

The biggest problem, one that absolutely needs to be pointed out, is the auto-running. It absolutely kills the game for me, and makes even simple and easy levels frustrating. This does make timing more important, but the fact that it complicates basically everything else makes the experience unenjoyable. There are several moments where you have to mash back and forth on the arrow keys to time a jump across an obstacle, or even doing it between two different obstacles, because you can't stop running. The objective of the game then goes from scaling walls and avoiding obstacles to figuring out how to get around the auto-running to successfully navigate.

The controls are also a bit frustrating. Delay in inputs means you have to make yourself jump or turn earlier than you want to, which probably isn't that bad until you play a level where optimal timing is essential. It showcases the downsides really boldly. Wall-jumping is the absolute hardest thing to do, as you'll either not jump when you want to in some cases, or not go far enough to the other side of the wall. There's even a glitch where your mummy climbs an invisible wall all the way up to the ledge. It's frustrating and hard to really replicate; it just tends to happen. It's amusing at first as well, until you run into an obstacle or fall because of it, and you may not even realize what's happening at first. When you're wall-jumping to avoid obstacles, it's a run killer. And I don't usually feel like it's my fault when I die, unlike other hard games, because the controls don't feel responsive.

There are other small glitches and bugs that aren't bad on their own, but dampen the experience overall. More than once have I wall-jumped, only to jump through the wall into my death. Some cases, I'll land inside the wall and can move around and jump out. I had to quit the game and reboot it when I beat the tutorial because no menus would pop up for me otherwise. Collision detection seems finicky, as I'll apparently have gotten into an obstacle when it seems like I've cleared this. This is most evident with the crocodile pit, but I'm willing to excuse that as just needing to be extra sure I clear it.

There are good things however! I like the vibe and aesthetic of the game, and the music wasn't annoying like most games in this genre tend to be. While you can only really jump over obstacles, the variety of traps and the methods in which they kill (or even affect) you is pleasant and refreshing. The ability to complete challenges and earn stuff at a decent enough rate is appreciated if one doesn't want to purchase any of the microtransactions, so you don't feel like you're grinding just to grind. On smaller notes, I appreciate that not only can you reduce the quality of the game, but even at the lowest settings for quality, it still looks really nice. Except for some hiccups in the period between dying and resetting, the game runs really well on my piece-of-shit computer.

The ability to play others' levels and rate them and compete on leaderboards for each level is appreciated, but there's a major problem here; you can't preview the map before playing. The most you get is around five seconds to survey the map, no matter how huge or littered with blocks/obstacles (and this includes the time it takes to zoom out to look at the map). You have to essentially dive into these maps blindly, and for maps that are either huge, complicated, or non-linear, this is a killer. I've quit maps several times because of this. Even something small like seeing a preview of the map before I play the level would help incredibly. It would also help so I know when to avoid levels that are essentially auto-completion or not designed well, and allow me to get the most out of the game.

Normally, this isn't the kind of game I'd play, but it's free and Early Access, so I decided to check it out. There's potential, and tightened up and improved on more, I could see myself coming back to this every once in a while to enjoy. But at this stage, I simply can't recommend it.

[h1]Other suggestions/nitpicks:[/h1]

[list]
[*]Please get rid of that slow clapping when you complete a level. It's really annoying.
[*]Achievements are always nice!
[*]A little more diversity in the music so I don't feel like I'm tuning out.
[*]Labeled menus. I could hardly tell what button to click because none of them were labeled or told me what to do or what function they had.
[*]Level of the Day/Week, something to emphasize the community's creations more.
[/list]

review:
Pyramid Raid is a really tough around the edges indie game. Pyramid Raid plays like a "runner" game with the added bonus of wall jumping thrown in here and there, when you add timed traps to that you can get a game that's pretty decent. The game comes with a level maker so you can also make and share your own courses with other players, and to top it off you can customize your mummy a little bit for added flavor. 

I liked Pyramid Raid, but overall there is nothing exceedingly special about the game. It can be fun, and I recommend you try it if you are into playing free indie games, otherwise there just is not that much here. Still, the game is neat enough to give it a positive review so if you are interested, don't be afraid to try it.

I say this pretty often, but this game is another argument for the need for a "neutral" option on steam reviews, instead of just YES or NO. View this as a tentative YES, leaning heavily towards NO for the state it's in right now. This game needs work. A lot of work. Also- some of the positive reviews are really fishy. First-time reviewers who are overly enthusiastic about a game they have .1 hours in. It reeks of friends + family reviews. One of them even has 'MUMMY' in their name. Review continues below: https://youtu.be/-yrVYc8kMVY 
The concept here is fantastic. It's sort of a blend of 'Battleblock Theater' and 'Mighty Quest For Epic Loot'. Build your 'pyramid' using blocks, traps, etc- to try to prevent other players from making it to the end and stealing your treasure. Similarly, of course- you try to defeat other players'. 

There is a cash shop. I'm holding off judgement on that for now, to see how necessary it seems... but for now, just know that there are seemingly only a small handful of items you can use in your Pyramid without having currency. It's DEFINITELY early access. There are some big issues. I can't get my xbox one controller to work with the game at all. Often at the start of a level, the game just repeatedly kills the character every second until you reset the game. It's often choppy. It definitely has promise, and there's some fun to be had even in this state. Just one more... Just one more...

This game seems quite light and easy at the start, but quickly sucks you in. 

The preset maps give a good tutorial on effective map setup, and how various obstacles work (and kill you in amusing, yet infuriating ways).

The real draw is the ability to create and share maps, with the condition you complete your map before publishing, ensuring that it CAN be done, but also means there is tons to try out and if ones too hard, you can simply play others without being stuck.

Ive noticed others mentioning bugs, but encountered none myself, except for a slight delay when trying to walljump, but can be accounted for once you learn to expect it.

Also, sarcophagi are the worst
 
Really fun game! I played in alpha and had some pretty funny moments challenging friends and trying to beat each other's levels while on skype calls with them. I see a lot more content has been added and brand new dev built levels to start with. It's great though, basically endless new levels because we build our own.

review:
Заурядный, неопрятно сделанный донатный платформер-раннер. Тематика изначально выбрана даже не совсем избитая - Египет с мумиями. Но управление говеное и примитивное, анимация дерганая, а левел-дизайн лежит на плечах толпы разноталантливых таких же как вы игроков, потому что проходить приходится именно их пирамиды. Плавали, знаем. Даже The Mighty Quest for Epic Loot с подобной механикой нормально не взлетел, чего уж говорить о его нищем собрате Pyramid Raid. Разработчикам пора бы понять, что игроки не будут делать за них 100% работы. Даже 50% не факт, что сделают. А если и сделают - то только после добросовестно выполненной первой половины самими авторами игры. 
Не задерживайтесь, проходите мимо. Игру не рекомендую.
